abstract: Facebook has put pressure on Christian Flickinger, a programmer, to remove code from his blog that would let someone change a profile page without logging into its site. How much control can it maintain as it opens to developers?
snippet: Facebook has put pressure on Christian Flickinger, a programmer, to remove code from his blog that would let someone change a profile page without logging into its site. How much control can it maintain as it opens to developers?
lead_paragraph: Is being half open like being half pregnant?
